Policies & Procedures. World Trade Center. Education. Personal.

Binder: Strategy Tactics Operational Mapping Plan (STOMP), set of maps showing by various divisions of NYC the locations of fire units, subways, generators, NYPD precincts, EMS deployments and stations, and community board, etc., by Bureau of Ops, Planning & Strategy Unit/Phoenix Unit (2000s). FDNY annual reports 1985, 1987, 1988. Various print matter on technical subjects, but appear to be implicitly connected with WTC recovery: safety rigging course (2001); "Evacuation Safety" (2000), with insert re: WTC emergency project training announcement; Fed regulations on construction with Powerpoint presentation inserts on trenching/evacuations and OSHA; two binders of material on training for crane operations (with a "Crane Risk Management Report in re: WTC emergency clean-up" executive summary (Oct 11, 2001). FDNY specific: booklets of NYC firehouse locations prepared by Don Schmidt of Battalion 4; Massey Pre-Fire Plans in Service for New York, division 1 (34th street down to Battery), includes key info on certain buildings, including New York Stock Exchange, Empire State Building, Hotel Pennsylvania, and World Financial Center (Oct 2001). 2 books re: WTC/9/11. 2 binders of personal material: 1 of material mostly about the James Tonry Memorial 5K Run, a benefit for the NY Firefighters Burn Center (first three annual runs, 1995-97); and various documents related to Spadafora's time as captain of Ladder Company 150 (snapshots, admin procedures, checklists, company dinner publicity, etc.). Announcement of Tonry's death in 1994 (member of Co 150). 1993-1995. VHS: FDNY Promotion Ceremony, 8/29/02. Floppies. (Includes digital formats, video)
